name: Cogito
overview: Cogito! is a 2-player board game for the Apple II based upon buying and selling property. Two players move about a 7 x 5 board, and start with $50,000 each. Each player starts in opposing corners, and on each turn can move 2 - 6 spaces up, down, left, or right. As the player moves, each empty space they land on is put up for sale in a blind auction, and players can bid 0 to $15,000 for each property, with the highest bidder winning the site. The first player to own 15 sites receives $2500. When the player moves onto their own property, they gain $500, but every third time they do this, the property becomes available for auction again. If the player moves onto an opponent's property, they must pay $1000, and the player gains $2000 if they land on the smiley face square. There is a skull square which moves about the board 1 square at a time, and the player who lands on the skull or has it land on them loses. Also, if a player runs out of money, they lose.
